posts.post_content:
If your opponent is playing a [Vesuvan Doppelganger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuvan Doppelganger) (or some other shapeshifter,) and you have [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines) in play... you can steal the Doppelganger, have it copy the confetti, then tear it up on your opponent's cards.  
  
Convoluted but terribly cruel.
posts.html:
If your opponent is playing a Vesuvan Doppelganger (or some other shapeshifter,) and you have March of the Machines in play... you can steal the Doppelganger, have it copy the confetti, then tear it up on your opponent's cards.

Convoluted but terribly cruel.
Report Abuse

posts.post_content: Based on the old legend about [Chaos Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chaos Orb) where a player supposedly tore it up to destroy his opponents board in the finals of a tournament. The fact that we have such wonderful urban legends as Chaos Confetti and Throat Wolf (make this for Un set 3 please) makes me happy to be apart of this community.

posts.post_content:
Here's a really long and complicated combo around this card that will probably result in lost friends.  
What you need on the field:  
[Concordant Crossroads](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Concordant Crossroads)(or some enchantment that gives creatures haste, preferably in green)  
[Fastbond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fastbond)  
[Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver)  
[Feldon's Cane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feldon's Cane)  
A tapped [Thran Weaponry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thran Weaponry)  
[Karn, Silver Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn, Silver Golem)  
Chaos Confetti  
[Rats of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rats of Rath)  
[Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice)  
[Krosan Restorer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Restorer) enchanted with [Freed from the Real](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Freed from the Real)  
[Staff of Domination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staff of Domination)  
[Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir)  
[Simic Growth Chamber](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Growth Chamber)  
And maybe some other lands. Doesn't really matter, though, thanks to Mycosynth Lattice. This goes a lot quicker if you've got threshold going.  
What you need in your hand:  
[Sky Swallower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sky Swallower)  
[Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave)  
  
Okay so. You start by usin... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Someone already pointed out the use of [Prototype Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prototype Portal) with Blacker Lotus, but it's even more useful with this. Even in the comp rules, the only mention of what a token can be represented by is "small items" (100.2). So if you use Prototype Portal, not only do you get to use the effect of Chaos Confetti without having to tear it up, but you can use any sort of "small item" as a token. Get creative! You could probably figure out something that you can tear up and be able to drop without as much flutter as a card.
posts.html:
Someone already pointed out the use of Prototype Portal with Blacker Lotus, but it's even more useful with this.
